businessSummary.oneLiner: AI-powered data analytics platform for government and enterprise ‚Äî transforming from a core U.S. defense and intelligence software partner into a commercial AI powerhouse.
businessSummary.description: Palantir builds software platforms that analyze and integrate complex data. Since the launch of AIP (AI Platform), the commercial segment has been growing explosively. Q4 2025 revenue reached $1.407B (+70% YoY), with U.S. commercial revenue hitting $507M (+137% YoY). Recent developments include a DHS $1B 5-year BPA (Blanket Purchase Agreement), an expanded Rackspace AI infrastructure partnership (30 to 250+ engineers, UK Sovereign data centers), and a Mizuho upgrade to Outperform ($195) ‚Äî but the stock is down 24% in 2026. The Percepta AI lawsuit saw the non-compete injunction denied (only non-solicitation granted), DISA IL5/IL6 on-premises and edge authorization was achieved, and Michael Burry published a $46 bear case ‚Äî creating an intensely divided bull-bear debate.
howTheyMakeMoney: U.S. Government: Data analytics platforms for DoD, CIA, NSA, DHS, and others ‚Äî Q4 $570M (+66% YoY)
U.S. Commercial: Enterprise AI and data analytics ‚Äî Q4 $507M (+137% YoY), the fastest-growing segment
International Government: Contracts with NATO allies and other foreign governments
International Commercial: Global enterprise clients (Airbus Skywise, etc.)
Subscription-based SaaS model: Annual contracts, top 20 customers averaging $94M/year (+45% YoY)
keyProducts: AIP (Artificial Intelligence Platform) ‚Äî Enterprise AI integration platform, the core growth engine
Gotham ‚Äî Data analysis and decision-making platform for government and defense
Foundry ‚Äî Enterprise data integration and operations platform
Apollo ‚Äî Software deployment automation and management infrastructure
TITAN ‚Äî U.S. Army next-generation intelligence system (large-scale contract)

keyMetrics.name: P/E Ratio (TTM)
keyMetrics.interpretation: Extremely elevated valuation. Even accounting for 70% growth, PEG exceeds 2.5. Burry has published a $46 bear case.

keyMetrics.name: Forward P/E
keyMetrics.interpretation: Based on 2026 consensus earnings. Approximately 4x the software sector average (~25x). Growth premium is extremely stretched.

keyMetrics.name: Revenue Growth (YoY)
keyMetrics.interpretation: 10 consecutive quarters of acceleration. U.S. commercial +137% YoY. Among the highest growth rates in software industry history.

keyMetrics.name: Operating Margin
keyMetrics.interpretation: Rule of 40 = 127% (70% growth + 57% adjusted margin). Top tier in the software industry.

keyMetrics.name: Free Cash Flow (Annual)
keyMetrics.interpretation: Q4 adjusted FCF $791M (56% margin). Strong cash generation. +82% YoY.

keyMetrics.name: Debt-to-Equity
keyMetrics.interpretation: Cash + short-term Treasuries of $7.2B, zero debt. Current ratio 7.11. A net cash fortress.

keyMetrics.name: 2026 Guidance
keyMetrics.interpretation: Q1 2026 guidance of $1.532-1.536B vs. consensus $1.32B ‚Äî a massive beat. Adjusted FCF guidance $3.93-4.13B.

growthDrivers.title: DHS $1B 5-year BPA ‚Äî procurement without competitive bidding
growthDrivers.description: Signed a 5-year, $1B Blanket Purchase Agreement with the Department of Homeland Security (confirmed Feb 19). CBP, ICE, Secret Service, FEMA, TSA, CISA, and other DHS sub-agencies can procure Palantir software without competitive bidding. RPO surged from $2.6B to $4.2B (+$1.6B), reflecting the pipeline.

growthDrivers.title: Rackspace partnership officially detailed ‚Äî 30 to 250+ dedicated engineers, UK Sovereign data centers
growthDrivers.description: Strategic partnership with Rackspace to accelerate AI deployment officially detailed (Feb 18). Running Foundry and AIP on Rackspace Private Cloud and UK Sovereign data centers. Dedicated Palantir engineering team scaling from 30 to 250+ within 12 months, massively expanding commercial AI deployment channels.

growthDrivers.title: U.S. commercial revenue +137% ‚Äî explosive growth with record deal value
growthDrivers.description: Q4 U.S. commercial revenue of $507M (+137% YoY). AIP-driven enterprise AI adoption is accelerating. Top 20 customers averaging $94M/year (+45% YoY). U.S. commercial deal value backlog up +145% YoY to $4.38B.

growthDrivers.title: DISA IL5/IL6 on-premises and edge authorization + Airbus Skywise renewal + Navy $440M
growthDrivers.description: PFCS Forward IL5/IL6 authorization (Feb 12) officially expands defense on-premises and edge deployments. Airbus extended its multi-year Skywise data platform deal (50,000+ daily users). Large contracts secured consecutively. Pipeline is at an all-time high across both government and commercial segments.

competitiveAdvantage.summary: Undisputed #1 in government and defense AI, with AIP rapidly building a strong commercial AI position. Irreplaceable in data security plus AI integration.

moats.description: Holds top-tier security authorizations from CIA, NSA, DHS, and others. DHS BPA enables procurement without competitive bidding. DISA IL5/IL6 on-premises and edge authorized. It would take competitors years to achieve equivalent clearance levels.
More customers improve the AI models, and better models attract more customers ‚Äî creating a virtuous cycle.
Deeply integrated into customer data infrastructure. The Airbus multi-year contract renewal and DHS 5-year BPA demonstrate the stickiness.

competitors.name: Snowflake
competitors.detail: Data cloud platform expanding AI capabilities, but weak in the government sector.

competitors.name: Databricks
competitors.detail: Private company, data lakehouse. Competes in enterprise AI.

competitors.name: C3.ai
competitors.detail: Enterprise AI platform. Significantly lags in growth rate and scale.

competitors.name: Percepta AI
competitors.detail: Founded by former key Palantir employees. Non-compete injunction denied, free to compete.

recentNews.headline: Mizuho upgrades from Neutral to Outperform at $195 ‚Äî 'growth + margin profile is one of a kind'
recentNews.significance: Mizuho analyst Gregg Moskowitz states 'the recent selloff is unjustifiable; AIP is a category of one,' upgrading to Outperform. Price target $195 implies +44% upside from current levels.

recentNews.headline: Percepta AI lawsuit ruling ‚Äî non-compete injunction denied, only non-solicitation granted
recentNews.significance: Federal judge denied the request to bar three former key employees from working at Percepta AI. Only a ban on soliciting Palantir employees was granted. The competitor is now free to operate, materializing the talent-poaching risk.

recentNews.headline: DHS confirms $1B 5-year BPA ‚Äî AI platform procurement without competitive bidding
recentNews.significance: CBP, ICE, Secret Service, FEMA, TSA, CISA, and other DHS sub-agencies can directly procure Palantir software. A single government contract adds $1B+ to backlog, streamlining future federal procurement.

recentNews.headline: Rackspace strategic partnership officially detailed ‚Äî 30 to 250+ engineers, UK Sovereign data centers
recentNews.significance: Deploying Foundry and AIP on Rackspace infrastructure, scaling dedicated engineers from 30 to 250+ within 12 months. UK Sovereign data center operations expand the international government and enterprise market channel.

recentNews.headline: DISA PFCS Forward IL5/IL6 authorization for on-premises and edge deployments
recentNews.significance: Critical authorization for on-premises and edge defense deployments. Expands from cloud-centric to edge environments, increasing the defense TAM.

recentNews.headline: Michael Burry publishes $46 bear case ‚Äî holds put options, criticizes CEO jet expenses
recentNews.significance: Burry published a $46/share bear case with $50-strike put options expiring in 2027. Criticized CEO Karp's $17.2M jet expenses (+123% YoY). Posted head-and-shoulders chart warning. Same day, Daiwa upgraded to Buy at $180 ‚Äî bull and bear narratives clashed directly.

analystOpinions.notableComment: 19-analyst coverage: 12 Buy, 5 Hold, 2 Sell. Average target $191 (+41%), street high $260 (Citi). Mizuho upgraded to Outperform $195 (2/21), Daiwa Buy $180, BofA Buy $255. Burry bear case at $46 (holds $50 puts expiring 2027). At $135.24, the stock sits 35% off its ATH.

risks.title: Extreme valuation ‚Äî P/E ~222x, Forward P/E ~102x, down 24% in 2026
risks.description: P/E of ~222x, Forward P/E of ~102x ‚Äî approximately 4x the software sector average. Amid the SaaS-pocalypse, further downside is possible. Burry has published a $46 bear case and disclosed $50-strike put options expiring in 2027. Both the 50-day SMA (~$173) and 200-day SMA (~$165) are above current price, confirming a downtrend.

risks.title: Percepta AI lawsuit ‚Äî non-compete injunction denied, talent drain risk materialized
risks.description: Three former key employees founded Percepta AI. Federal judge denied the non-compete injunction (Feb 18-20), granting only a non-solicitation order. The competitor is free to operate, raising structural moat erosion and further talent drain concerns.

risks.title: Burry $46 bear case ‚Äî 'wicked accounting,' CEO $17.2M jet expenses
risks.description: Burry published a $46/share bear case and holds $50-strike put options expiring in 2027. Accounts receivable grew faster than revenue in 9 of 12 quarters. CEO Karp's $17.2M jet expenses (+123% YoY). Share count diluting +4.67% YoY.

risks.title: SaaS-pocalypse ‚Äî fears that AI could replace traditional SaaS
risks.description: Market fears that AI will render traditional SaaS obsolete are driving broad SaaS selloffs. Stock declining despite DHS, Rackspace, and Mizuho catalysts proves deteriorating sentiment.

risks.title: Government budget dependency and DOGE spending cut risk
risks.description: While the DHS $1B BPA is positive, government spending cut initiatives could have a direct impact. Government revenue remains a large portion of the overall mix, posing concentration risk.

buyReasons.title: DHS $1B BPA + Airbus Skywise + Navy $440M ‚Äî pipeline at all-time high
buyReasons.rationale: Major contracts secured consecutively. The DHS BPA creates a no-bid procurement channel, locking in long-term revenue. 2026 guidance of $7.18-7.20B (+61% YoY) and Q1 guidance of $1.532-1.536B (vs. $1.32B consensus) secure strong growth visibility.

buyReasons.title: 35% correction from ATH + debt-free cash fortress of $7.2B
buyReasons.rationale: Cash + short-term Treasuries of $7.2B, zero debt, current ratio of 7.11. Mizuho Outperform $195, Daiwa Buy $180, Citi $260. Average target $191 implies +41% upside from current levels.

buyReasons.title: Rule of 40 = 127% ‚Äî unprecedented growth and margin combination in software history
buyReasons.rationale: 70% growth + 57% adjusted margin. U.S. commercial +137% YoY, deal value backlog +145% YoY. AIP enterprise adoption is accelerating, and the Rackspace partnership (30 to 250+ engineers, UK Sovereign) massively expands deployment channels.

overallOpinion: DHS $1B BPA (confirmed Feb 19), Rackspace partnership (30 to 250+ engineers, UK Sovereign), and U.S. commercial +137% growth demonstrate real traction. Q1 guidance also crushed the $1.32B consensus at $1.53B.

P/E of ~222x and Forward P/E of ~102x are overvalued territory. The SaaS-pocalypse and Burry's $46 bear case ($50 puts, 2027 expiry) have driven a 24% decline in 2026 ‚Äî now 35% off ATH, trading below both the 50-day and 200-day moving averages.
Mizuho Outperform $195 (Feb 21), Daiwa Buy $180, Citi Strong Buy $260 ‚Äî 12 of 19 analysts are buyers. Average target $191 implies +41% upside.

Percepta AI non-compete injunction denial (Feb 18-20) materializes talent-drain risk. Only non-solicitation was granted, leaving the competitor free to operate. Whether the structural moat holds is the key variable.

Q1 earnings will determine whether this is unfairly caught in the SaaS-pocalypse or a legitimate valuation reset. RSI of 40 approaches oversold territory. DISA IL5/IL6 edge authorization serves as a defense TAM expansion catalyst.
